summary: Tens of thousands of people die each year from breast or cervical cancer. Early screening, detection, and prompt treatment saves lives. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's Early Detection Program provides screening and diagnostic services to low-income and uninsured or underinsured people. States may extend Medicaid to people who aren't otherwise eligible if they are screened under this program and require treatment. Our analysis...
title: Public Health: Federal Programs Provide Screening and Treatment for Breast and Cervical Cancer
